intro: Sacciolepis clatrata, commonly known as the red-flowered sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, bright red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, woody pods that contain its seeds. It thrives in sandy soils and is often found in dune environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing the shoreline. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
